mechanoreception.notes: As sponges, Grantiidae likely possess mechanoreceptors to detect water currents and changes in their environment. This is inferred based on general sponge biology.

chemoreception.notes: Sponges are known to use chemoreception to detect food particles and other chemical cues in the water.

photoreception.notes: It is unknown whether members of the Grantiidae family possess photoreceptors. There is no information about this in the provided context.
